meanings.definition: Abnormal positioning or displacement of an organ or body part.
meanings.sent1: The ectopy of the heart can cause irregular heartbeats.
meanings.sent2: Doctors discovered ectopy in the patient's stomach during the surgery.
meanings.sent3: The ectopy of the liver decided to take a vacation to the lungs.
meanings.sent4: Her ectopy of thoughts led her to unexpected conclusions.
meanings.sent5: The ectopy of the bone made it impossible for him to walk.

meanings.definition: The act or process of being displaced or positioned abnormally.
meanings.sent1: After the ectopy of the knee, he had trouble walking.
meanings.sent2: The ectopy of the book on the shelf caught her attention.
meanings.sent3: The ectopy of the chair made it the center of attention in the room.
meanings.sent4: His ectopy of emotions made it hard for him to express himself.
meanings.sent5: The ectopy of the painting on the wall added a unique touch to the room.
